Dear Ms. Haas:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
07/15/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include
the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result. Please
review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In the event
that I am not available and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact the area
manager at (269) 243-2725.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
COF Rule 400.10113-f Employee records
Employee records shall be maintained for each
employee and shall include all of the following
information:
(f) A written evaluation of the employee's
performance within the first 6 months of each
position designated by these rules and annually
thereafter.
Two out of five applicable employee files reviewed did not contain timely
performance evaluations.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was provided regarding ensuring clarity of necessary items
required in service planning.
V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was provided during this inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: One
corrective action plan was approved during this report period. This CAP was a
result of a rule violation found in Special Investigation #2024SIC0001535. This
corrective action plan addressed training in a new restraint model for the facility as
changes to facility policy & procedure to match the new restraint model. At the time
of this inspection there was a repeat finding for this rule (SIR #2025SIC0000703
dated 7/29/25), but the CAP has not yet been approved.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and expense documentation for the facility was provided by the
overseeing organization and no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
A written assessment from the chief administrator is not required for COF facilities.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were completed during an announced, face-to-face visit to the
facility on 07/15/2025. Staff reported feeling supported and well trained working at
the facility. Some commented on changes in administration but did not report any

negative effects other than getting used to expected changes in leadership. Staff
also reported feeling confident in the new restraint model being implemented.
Youth were interviewed during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
07/15/2025. They reported feeling safe and well cared for at the facility. Youth
also commented on good communication from staff and felt like the programming
implemented was done in a fair manner.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility was toured during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
07/15/2025. No changes or remodeling to the building have occurred and the
facility was in clean and organized condition. Cleaning items and supplies for youth
were well stocked.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
